member.name: T:LandMapRLibrary.ATTR_IN
member.summary: the field name of the column in the source file that contains the input variable to be used to compute the fuzzy attribute currently being defined

member.name: T:LandMapRLibrary.CLASS_OUT
member.summary: the kind of fuzzy model to use to re-scale the raw input value for each grid cell into a fuzzy likelihood value scaled from 0 to 100.

member.name: T:LandMapRLibrary.FILE_IN
member.summary: The field File_in tells the program to obtain data for the first 10 attributes from data stored in the formfile (ID#Form) DBF table and to obtain data to compute the next 7 fuzzy attributes from the relzfile (ID#Relz)

member.summary: Lower left y coordinate.

member.summary: Number of rows in the grid.

member.name: P:LandMapRLibrary.LandMapROptions.Columns
member.summary: Number of columns in the grid.

member.name: P:LandMapRLibrary.LandMapROptions.GridSize
member.summary: Resolution in meters.

member.name: P:LandMapRLibrary.LandMapROptions.MissingDataValue
member.summary: Value to determine which cells have missing data.

member.name: P:LandMapRLibrary.LandMapROptions.PitArea
member.summary: Threshold values (in meters) for pit areas that are to be removed.

member.name: P:LandMapRLibrary.LandMapROptions.PitDepth
member.summary: Threshold values (in meters) for pit depths that are to be removed.

member.name: P:LandMapRLibrary.LandMapROptions.InvertedElevation
member.summary: Whether elevation data is inverted.

member.name: P:LandMapRLibrary.LandMapROptions.DownslopeArea
member.summary: Threshold value for downslope area. The 300 cell value seems to be particularly suitable when processing relatively high resolution (5-10 m horizontal grid cells) DEM data for field and farm sized areas (800 m to 1600 m on a side). For DEM data sets with a very small number of cells (e.g. less than 10,000) it may frequently be necessary to select lower threshold values (100-200 cells) as there are simply not enough cells in the DEM to produce large upslope area counts in the range of 300 or greater. For very large DEM data sets containing 1 million cells or more, it has often proven better to select threshold values closer to 1000 cells as lower thresholds can result in recognition of channel networks that are overly detailed and confusing.

member.name: P:LandMapRLibrary.LandMapROptions.UpslopeArea
member.summary: Threshold value for upslope area. The 300 cell value seems to be particularly suitable when processing relatively high resolution (5-10 m horizontal grid cells) DEM data for field and farm sized areas (800 m to 1600 m on a side). For DEM data sets with a very small number of cells (e.g. less than 10,000) it may frequently be necessary to select lower threshold values (100-200 cells) as there are simply not enough cells in the DEM to produce large upslope area counts in the range of 300 or greater. For very large DEM data sets containing 1 million cells or more, it has often proven better to select threshold values closer to 1000 cells as lower thresholds can result in recognition of channel networks that are overly detailed and confusing.

member.name: P:LandMapRLibrary.LandMapROptions.LM3ARules
member.summary: Fuzzy attribute file.

member.name: P:LandMapRLibrary.LandMapROptions.LM3CRules
member.summary: Fuzzy facet rules.

member.name: M:LandMapRLibrary.LandMapROptions.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Int64,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor with default fuzzy classification rules.
member.param: The directory in which the files processed from the C++ DLL will be outputted to.
The interpolated input elevation file with just the elevation values.
The lower left x coordinate of the interpolated data set you are inputting. Must be in meters. Lat/Lng not accepted.
The lower left y coordinate of the interpolated data set you are inputting. Must be in meters. Lat/Lng not accepted.
The number of rows in the interpolated input file.
The number of columns in the interpolated input file.
The resoultion in meters.
Maximum area of pit to remove. Suggested default value of 10.
Maximum depth of pit to remove. Suggested default value of 0.15.
Threshold value for downslope area. Suggested default of 300 since it has been found to work well with many kinds of terrain.
Threshold value for upslope area. Suggested default of 300 since it has been found to work well with many kinds of terrain.
The name to prefix your output files with.

member.summary: Constructor that allows customized fuzzy classification rules.
member.param: The directory in which the files processed from the C++ DLL will be outputted to.
The interpolated input elevation file with just the elevation values.
The lower left x coordinate of the interpolated data set you are inputting. Must be in meters. Lat/Lng not accepted.
The lower left y coordinate of the interpolated data set you are inputting. Must be in meters. Lat/Lng not accepted.
The number of rows in the interpolated input file.
The number of columns in the interpolated input file.
The resoultion in meters.
Custom LM3ARules. If you specify your own we have no idea what will happen. Use at your own discretion.
Custom LM3CRules. If you specify your own we have no idea what will happen. Use at your own discretion.
Maximum area of pit to remove. Suggested default value of 10.
Maximum depth of pit to remove. Suggested default value of 0.15.
Threshold value for downslope area. Suggested default of 300 since it has been found to work well with many kinds of terrain. See property description for more detailed information.
Threshold value for upslope area. Suggested default of 300 since it has been found to work well with many kinds of terrain. See property description for more detailed information.
The name to prefix your output files with.
